For what it's worth, I used to feel the same way before I sacked up and asked Emily out. She had just started university when we met, and I couldn't afford to go, so I thought she was out of my league. Anyways, I didn't know she secretly liked me too, so we hit things off immediately... been that way ever since."

"What's your point?" He asks sullenly.

You think he knows already, but a part of you just wants to kill some time talking while you wait for Trinity. "So approach her with confidence, man. Talk her up. You've got interests, you're not a boring person. If she's not into you... fine, no more doubt. But if she likes you, then that's your chance to do something together."

"I'll think about it, Kyle." He mumbles, before stubbing out his cigarette with his shoe. He puts his mittened hands in his coat pockets. "What are you doing out here this morning, anyway?"

"Just killing time before my shift starts." You lie, glad to see Harold nod casually as he re-enters the building. You didn't want him there to witness your swap with Trinity.

Speaking of which, you finally see her car swing into the parking lot.

As Trinity emerges, you gaze over her body in a different light. Sure, you admire her strawberry blonde hair, carefully straightened and thickened as it seems to shine in the early morning sunlight. And sure, you like the way her hourglass figure seems to bounce and wiggle in all the right places as she sashays toward you. Even if her mouthwatering curves are mostly hidden in the gauche uniform you're all required to wear out on the sales floors.

But this time you know you'll be inhabiting her form, wearing her body, literally stepping into her shoes. Briefly you wonder if she's looking at you now in the same way.

Even Emily noticed how long you took to get ready for work this morning. You threw on your best white button-up dress shirt, which you had ironed the night before. You combed your hair and used an extra dollop of hair gel; in addition, you flossed your teeth and rinsed with mouthwash. And for once, Emily was the one banging on the bathroom door waiting for her turn to get ready for university.

Like cleaning house in anticipation of a guest, you tried to make yourself nice and presentable for Trinity when you switch with her. You regret not going to the gym as often as you could, as you had appraised your own figure in the mirror earlier that morning. But by most accounts you consider yourself in reasonably good shape. Not too thin. Tall and fit enough for a guy your age. Not really possessing the ability to stand apart and judge yourself from someone else's eyes... until yesterday.

So you wonder what Trinity must be thinking as she approaches and softly greets you in the alleyway.

"Good morning, Kyle." She smiles, looking up at you.

Your heart thumps in your chest. "Hey Trinity! Glad you could make it. We don't have much time before our shifts begin." You point to your wristwatch.

"Sorry about being a little late." She clasps her hands apologetically.

"Don't worry about it." You fold your arms. "So did you convince your friends to come visit you today and leave some positive feedback? You know... to improve your reputation with Miss Melvin?"

She stares at you with a blank expression before finally pounding her hand. "So that's what I forgot to do! Frick!" She shows you her index finger, which has a white string tied around it. "I was racking my brains all morning trying to remember why I had this little thing around my finger. I usually do this when there's something important but I must have misplaced the note I had written when I got home yesterday. Stupid, stupid!"

She shakes her head, and you place your hands on her shoulders. "Calm down, Trin." You order. "And don't worry! I know a couple of people who plan to come in sometime today to help out."

"Oh, thank you so much!" A wave of relief passes over Trinity's face.

"So... are you ready to swap?" You give a sidelong glance in the alley, still finding it empty except for you two.

"Yes." She bites her lip nervously.

You grab onto her hands and stare intensely into her eyes. Her dazzling, baby blue eyes.

"Trinity Fushia..."

A split second later, the world shifts and tumbles leaving you disoriented. As quickly as it begins it stops. And you find yourself gazing upwards at your old body.

You've become Trinity again!

"Wow! This is incredible!" Trinity says, letting go of your hands and using her own to pat herself down. She looks at her new arms, chest, and legs. "Mmm... you smell nice today."

"Uh, thanks, it's a new cologne." You murmur in Trinity's syrupy voice. Then, feeling obligated to return the favour, you add, "I like your hair, is this your natural colour?"

Trinity giggles, sounding overly effeminate. "Don't you mean your hair now? And... wow! Your thingy has a mind of its own down here!"

She draws your attention to her trousers, as a noticeable bulge protrudes from her fly. It twitches a little, and you step back awkwardly.

"Thanks for sharing," You deadpan, "Now control yourself please! We only have a couple minutes until we have to go inside."

"Ohmigosh, do boys have to deal with this all the time??" She lisps in your voice.

"Just think about something else... anything else will do." You grow frustrated. You're not sure whether Trinity can capably impersonate you for the entire day. She might have handled being you for a few hours yesterday, but someone is bound to notice something weird eventually unless she focuses. Which, it turns out, seems to be a tall order for a scatterbrain like Trinity.

You open the back door and head to the employees' office, a shared space with sets of lockers for storing valuables in between shifts. Trinity follows close behind, even though your car keys, wallet, and cell phone fit conveniently in her pockets.

You, on the other hand, have to deposit Trinity's purse into a locker. You use her key and swing open Trinity's locker, stuffing her purse inside where it sits along with a few other sundry items (a box of pain relievers, a tube of lip balm, a charging cord, among other things).

Tanya Wessing, a middle-aged woman who works on the Maternity/Baby sales floor which is next to Lingerie, smiles politely at you as you walk on by. She's overweight but has a heart of gold. Her husband passed away several years ago and her adult children have moved out, so she works here mainly for something to do.

But you don't feel like talking to her, not yet anyways. Your eyes briefly make contact with Miss Melvin, whose gaze seems to sear into you like a hot iron. But she doesn't say anything, perhaps still thinking Trinity is on thin ice and waiting for just one more complaint to do her in.

You're still not going to give her that chance.

For a moment you consider swapping into Miss Melvin's body and using her authority as the day shift manager to erase the bad parts from Trinity's employee file. But that would mean putting her into Trinity's body. You're not sure Trinity would like that, and you wouldn't want that bossy woman occupying your own life either.

But it's an interesting idea. And it gives you the chance to test whether you can swap with another person while already swapped with someone else. You still don't know much about this amazing power and to what limits, if any, you can use it.

What do you decide to do?

info.brief_description: Kyle Blunt is bored and gains the power to swap bodies by saying peoples names.
info.description:
Your name is Kyle Blunt and you were bored. You were at work and finding it excessively dull as always when you suddenly gain the power to swap bodies with anyone simply by focussing on them while saying their name.

Basic rules:
-use good grammar
-no personality changes

Please add chapters and have fun!
info.pretty_title: Say a name and swap away
